thread.title: H.S. ROUNDUP: Brockton wins Sullivan Tournament
thread.title_full: H.S. ROUNDUP: Brockton wins Sullivan Tournament

author: Staff Reports
title: H.S. ROUNDUP: Brockton wins Sullivan Tournament
text: Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 12:25 AM Updated at 12:31 AM Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 12:25 AM Updated at 12:31 AM The Brockton High golf team captured the 33rd annual Sullivan Memorial Tournament Monday at Thorny Lea Golf Club, topping the six-team field with a score of 238. Finishing second through fourth to propel the Boxers to the win were seniors Korey Paull (8-over 78), Daron Merian (79) and Mike Moran (81). Newton North’s Dan Kurson was medalist with a 76. Following Brockton in the team scoring was Newton North (251), Waltham (272), New Bedford (274), Cambridge Rindge and Latin (275), and Durfee (299). In other high school action: BOYS GOLF Martha’s Vineyard 241, Whitman-Hanson 249: The Panthers (8-9) came up short on the road, as a win would have secured a spot in the state tournament. Junior John Murphy shot a 4-over 39 and sophomore Matt Stanish finished at 5-over 40. The Panthers’ regular season concludes with a road trip Wednesday to face Silver Lake at the Country Club of Halifax. Hanover 241, Quincy/North Quincy 274, Plymouth South 278: Sophomore Luke Smigliasi shot a 37 for the Indians (15-1) in their tri-match at Presidents Golf Course in Quincy. Sophomore Drew Cratty finished at 38 and junior Charlie Banks carded a 39. Field Hockey Bridgewater-Raynham 3, Plymouth South 2: The Trojans improved to 9-2-1 overall with a non-league victory that featured three different goal scorers. Senior Carly Doulette and sophomores Katie Swart and Savannah Paige all found the back of the net. Juniors Ali Daisy and Maria Savignano recorded assists. Bridgewater-Raynham is 3-0-1 in the Old Colony League. Scituate 3, Marshfield 1: Lulu Sweeney potted a pair of goals to lead the Sailors (8-4) in their home victory. Sabine Adorney added the third for Scituate. Middleboro 1, Nauset 1: Abby Ethier tallied the lone goal for the Sachems, assisted by Hayden Bagnell-Pettine and Erin Early. Girls Soccer Avon 2, Upper Cape 1: Senior midfielder Gina Early-Ashby provided assists on both goals for the Panthers (6-3-2, 2-1-2 Mayflower League). Her two corner kicks helped Meaghan Mahoney and Nicole Pepe each find the back of the net. Middleboro 3, Wareham 0: The Sachems picked up a non-league shutout victory. Jess Baldassini, Jasmine Lees and Bailey Glenn all had goals. Assists came from Courtney Chane (two) and Haley Wood. Bridgewater-Raynham 4, Marshfield 1: The Rams’ (7-4-2) lone goal came from Bri de Grasse, assisted by Bugsy Nerger and Micaela Pitts. Norwell 1, Duxbury 0: Stephanie Croke netted the game winner for the Clippers (9-2-2), assisted by freshman Lexi Rothman. Rachel Bailey made nine saves in net, and Tessa Holleran had a strong game on defense. Abington 2, Rockland 2: The Green Wave improved to 4-5-3 overall behind two goals from freshman Madison Grafton. Senior goalkeeper Alyssa Devlin had a strong game in the tie at home. Rockland scorers were Grace Oliver and Brooke Jones. Page 2 of 2 - Boys Soccer Norwell 1, Duxbury 1: The Dragons (7-2-2) tied a Patriot League game at home with a goal from junior Jose DaSilva. Duxbury plays Plymouth North Tuesday, and needs one win to qualify for the postseason tournament. Fairfield Prep 1, BC High 0: Christian Botero made 16 saves in net for the Eagles, including stopping a penalty kick. Marshfield 1, Bridgewater-Raynham 0: The Rams shut out the Trojans in non-league action. Sandwich 2, Hingham 1: The Knights doubled up the Harbormen in a non-league game. Rockland 7, Abington 2: Joe Kimball netted five goals for the Bulldogs in the win. Mike Porcello scored on a penalty kick for the Green Wave’s second goal. By Staff Reports
